net.xeoh.plugins.informationbroker

Interface InformationBroker

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Plugin
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    InformationBrokerUtil

    public interface InformationBroker
extends Plugin
    Think of the information broker as a large, shared and type-safe hybrid between a Map and a Bus. It enables you to exchange information between a number of plugins by well known keys. In contrast to a Bus, the exchanged items are stored and can be retrieved by their key any time. Like the bus, however, listeners can register for updates to certain keys to be able to react on changes to them.

    The new InformationBroker interface supersedes the old Bus (previously present in JSPF), as it provides similar functionality.

    Author:
    Ralf Biedert
    See Also:
    InformationItem, InformationBrokerUtil

    • Method Detail

      • publish

        <T> void publish(java.lang.Class<? extends InformationItem<T>> channel,
               T item,
               PublishOption... options)
        Publishes a new information item. The item will be made available to all listeners subscribed to the item, or requesting it later. For example, to publish the current user name you could write:

        publish(UserName.class, "John Doe");

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the item to wait for.
        Parameters:
        channel - The channel for which the new object should be published.
        item - The items to publish.
        options - A number of options the publish() method understands.

      • subscribe

        <T> void subscribe(java.lang.Class<? extends InformationItem<T>> channel,
                 InformationListener<T> listener,
                 SubscribeOption... options)
        Subscribes to a given information item. The listener will be called as soon as the item changes. It will also be called when the item has already been set before. For example, to subscribe to the latest location of a device (provided as a String) you could write:

        plugin.subscribe(UserName.class, new InformationListener<String>() {
            public void update(String item) {
                 ...
            }
        });

        Also see the InformationBrokerUtil, it contains many useful convenience functions.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the item to wait for.
        Parameters:
        channel - The item / ID / channel to subscribe to
        listener - The lister will be called whenever the value of the ID changes; and it will be called right away if the information item has already been set before.
        options - A number of options the subscribe() method understands.

      • unsubscribe

        void unsubscribe(InformationListener<?> listener)
        Unsubscribes the given information listener. It will not be called anymore afterwards.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to unsubscribe.
